intro: Crotalaria mabobo, commonly known as the Mabobo crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in well-drained soils. Its seeds are enclosed in pod-like structures, and the plant is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, enriching the soil. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and research settings.
